Darkvision.description: Aberrations can see in the dark up to 60 feet.

Low-light Vision.description: Animals can see color in dim light.

Darkvision.description: Constructs can see in the dark up to 60 feet.

Low-light Vision.description: Constructs can see color in dim light.

Construct Immunities.description: Constructs are magically animated or artificially created creatures, granting them a number of immunities.
Construct Immunities.shortText: nonlethal damage, necromancy, fatigue, exhaustion, stunning, paralysis, sleep, poison, mind effects, disease, ability damage, death effects, ability drain, energy drain, fort saves

Darkvision.description: Dragons can see in the dark up to 60 feet.

Low-light Vision.description: Dragons can see color in dim light.

Dragon Immunities.description: Dragons are immune to magical sleep and paralysis.

Low-light Vision.description: Fey can see color in dim light.

Darkvision.description: Magical Beasts can see in the dark up to 60 feet.

Low-light Vision.description: Magical Beasts can see color in dim light.

Darkvision.description: Monstrous Humanoids can see in the dark up to 60 feet.

Blind.description: Oozes are blind, they have no eyes but do possess blindsight.

Ooze Immunities.description: Oozes have no Intelligence score, giving them immunity to mind effects, they also have a number of other immunities.
Ooze Immunities.shortText: mind effects, gaze attacks, visual effects, illusions, poison, sleep, paralysis, polymorph, stunning, critical hits, flanking, precision damage

Darkvision.description: Outsiders can see in the dark up to 60 feet.

Low-light Vision.description: Plants can see color in dim light.

Plant Immunities.description: Plants are immune to a number of afects and abilities, mostly related to poisons or mind effects.
Plant Immunities.shortText: mind effects, paralysis, poison, polymorph, sleep, stunning

Darkvision.description: Undead can see in the dark up to 60 feet.

Undead Immunities.description: Undead are immune to a number of afects and abilities, mostly related to injuries the living may sustain like diseases.
Undead Immunities.shortText: mind effects, bleed, death effects, disease, paralysis, poison, sleep, stunning, nonlethal damage, ability drain, energy drain, physical ability damage, exhaustion, fatigue, fort saves

Darkvision.description: Vermin can see in the dark up to 60 feet.

Mindless.description: Vermin have no intelligence score, and immunity to all mind-affecting effects.

Aeon Immunities.description: Aeons are immune to cold, poison, and critical hits.

Aeon Resistances.description: Aeons gain resistance to electricity and fire.

Envisaging (Su).description: Aeons do not speak and instead use a form of non-verbal telepathy. For instance, an aeon seeking to raze a city communicates this concept to non-aeons by sending them a vivid image of the city crumbling to ash.

Extension of All (Ex).description: Aeons are connected to the mltiverse itself and through it eachother, this grants them great knowlesge in the form of a racial bonus equal to half their racial Hit Dice on all Knowledge skill checks.

Void Form (Su).description: Aoens are semi-tangible, granting them a deflection bonus equal to 25% their HD.Though aeons aren’t incorporeal , their forms are only a semi-tangible manifestation of something greater. An aeon’s void form grants it a deflection bonus equal to 1/4 its Hit Dice (rounded down).

Agathion Immunities.description: Agathions are immune to electricity and petrification.

Agathion Resistances.description: Agathion gain resistance to cold and sonic.

Low-light Vision.description: Agathions can see color in dim light.

Lay on Hands.description: Agathions can use Lay on Hands as a paladin of the same level as their HD. You may touch a creature as a standard action to infuse 1d6 every 2 HD. You may touch yourself as a swift action.

Poison Resistance.description: Agathions gain a +4 racial bonus to saves against poison.

Agathion Tongues.description: Agathions speak Celestial, Infernal, and Draconic

Speak with Animals (Su).description: Agathions may cast speak with animals, with caster level equal to their HD and not requiring any sound.

Truespeech (Su).description: Agathions can speak with any creature that has a language, as though using tongues (CL = HD)

Air Walk.description: Air creatures have fly speeds and usually have perfect maneuverability, as well as gain Fly as a class skill.

Darkvision.description: Angels can see in the dark up to 60 feet.

Low-light Vision.description: Angels can see color in dim light.

Angelic Immunities.description: Angels are immune to acid, cold, and petrification.

Angelic Resistances.description: Angels gain resistance tp electricity and fire.

Poison Resistance.description: Angels gain a +4 racial bonus to saves against poison.

Protective Aura (Su).description: Anyone within 20 ft of the angel gets a +4 deflection bonus to AC and a +4 resistance bonus to saves vs evil creatures. This aura also acts as a magic circle against evil and a lesser globe of invulnerability (suppresses spells and spell-like abilities [Sp] of up to 3rd level) both with a radius of 20 ft.

Truespeech (Su).description: Angels can speak with any creature that has a language, as though using tongues (CL = HD)

Aquatic.description: Aquatic creatures have swim speeds and can move in water without making swim checks. They also gain Swim as a class skill, but cannot breathe air and instead breathes water.

Darkvision.description: Archons can see in the dark up to 60 feet.

Low-light Vision.description: Archons can see color in dim light.

Archon Immunities.description: Archons are immune to electricity and petrification.

Poison Resistance.description: Archons gain a +4 racial bonus to saves against poison.

Aura of Menace (Su).description: When fighting or angry, archons generate an aura requiring a DC # Will save for hostiles. Failure inflicts a -2 to attacks, AC, and saves for 24 hours or until they hit the archon.

Teleport (Sp).description: Archons can use greater teleport at will (CL 14), except that the creature can transport only itself and up to 50 pounds of carried objects.

Truespeech (Su).description: Archons can speak with any creature that has a language, as though using tongues (CL 14)

Asura Immunities.description: Asuras are immune to curses, disease and poison.

Asura Resistances.description: Asuras gain a number of resistances.

Asura Will.description: Asuras gain a +2 racial bonus on saving throws against enchantment spells.

Telepathy (Su).description: Asuras can mentally communicate with other creatures that have a language, and may address multiple creatures at once (with difficulty).

Elusive Aura (Su).description: Asuras exude an aura that affects creatures with a nondetection spell.

Regeneration (Ex).description: Asuras can regenerate at varying rates, with Good weaopns and spells being able to kill them.

Spell resistance (Ex).description: Asuras are resistant to magic, (SR = 11 + CR).

Summon (Sp).description: Asuras can summon other asuras, usually one of the same or a few weaker ones.

Asura Skills.description: Asuras gain a +6 racial bonus to Escape Artist and a +4 racial bonus to Perception.

Darkvision.description: Automatons can see in the dark up to 120 feet.

Low-light Vision.description: Automatons can see color in dim light.

Automaton Resistances.description: Automatons are resistant to cold and sonic.

Spell resistance (Ex).description: Automatons are resistant to magic, (SR = 11 + CR).

Telepathy (Su).description: Automatons can mentally communicate with other creatures that have a language, and may address multiple creatures at once (with difficulty).

Automaton Core (Ex).description: Automatons are powered by a core infused with life energy, which is left behind after an automaton is destroyed.

Intelligent Construct (Ex).description: Automatons are intelligent constructs and can take class levels. They also get Climb, Craft, Diplomacy, Fly, Intimidate, Knowlegde (all), Perception, Sense Motive, Spellcradt, Stealth, and Use Magic Device as class skills.

Vulnerable Mind (Ex).description: Automatons are not immune to mind effects.

Darkvision.description: Azatas can see in the dark up to 60 feet.

Low-light Vision.description: Azatas can see color in dim light.

Azata Immunities.description: Azatas are immune to electricity and petrification.

Azata Resistances.description: Azatas are resistant to cold and fire.

Truespeech (Su).description: Azatas can speak with any creature that has a language, as though using tongues (CL 14)

Stability.description: An amaru gets a +4 racial bonus to CMD when resisting bull rush or trip attempts.
Stability.shortText: You have a +4 bonus to CMD vs Trips & Bull Rush

Stalker.description: Perception and stealth are always considered class skills for an amaru.
Stalker.shortText: Perception and Stealth are class skills

Pyromaniac.description: An amaru is treated as 1 level higher when casting spells with the fire descriptor or that deal fire damage. In addition, Amarus with a charisma score of 11 or higher gain dancing lights, flare, prestidigitaion, and produce flame, as spell-like abilities, usable once per day.
Pyromaniac.shortText: Treat your Caster Level as 1 higher for fire spells

Hypnotic Gaze.description: Amarus can cast hypnotism once a day, for 1 round.

Darkvision.description: An amaru can see in the dark up to 60 feet.

Prehensile Tail.description: Amarus can use their tail to carry objects. They cannot wield weapons with their tails, but can retrieve small, stored objects carried on them as a swift action.
Prehensile Tail.shortText: Retrieve small items as a swift action

Eagle Eyes.description: Avaar gain a +2 racial bonus on Perception checks and treat Perception as a class skill.
Eagle Eyes.shortText: +2 bonus to Perception and treat it as a class skill

Envoy.description: Avaar with an Intelligence score of 11 or higher gain comprehend languages, detect magic, detect poison, and read magic as spell-like abilities that can be used once a day.

Flight.description: Avaar have a fly speed of 50 feet with average maneuverability.

Cat's Luck.description: Once per day, before making a Reflex saving throw, a cæth can roll twice and take the better result.
Cat's Luck.shortText: Roll twice on a Reflex Save

Curiosity.description: Cæth gain a +4 racial bonus on Diplomacy checks and treat Knowledge (history and local) as class skills. If either is already a class skill, they get a +2 racial bonus instead.

Stalker.description: Perception and Stealth are always class skills for cæth.
Stalker.shortText: Perception and Stealth are class skills

Jumper.description: Cæth are always considered to have a running start when making an Acrobatics check to jump (DCs are doubled without a running start).
Jumper.shortText: You always have a running start for jumps

Claws.description: Cæth have strong claws that they can use as a primary natural attacks. They can make 2 attacks per turn that deal 1d4 + their strength modifier slashing damage.

Low-Light Vision.description: Caeth can see in color up to 60 feet away in dim light.
Geiter can see in color up to 60 feet away in dim light.

Healthy.description: Geiter gain a +4 racial bonus on Fortitude saves against disease and poison, including magical diseases.

Mountain-Born.description: Geiter gain a +2 racial bonus on Acrobatics checks made to cross narrow ledges.

Craftsman.description: Geiter gain a +2 racial bonus on Craft and Profession checks when using metal or stone.

benefit.text: +2 Craft and Profession when using metal or stone

Stonecunning.description: Geiter gain a +2 racial bonus on Perception checks to notice unusual stonework, such as traps and hidden doors. They recieve a check to notice such features whenever they pass within 10 feet, whether or not they are actively looking.

Mountaineer.description: Geiter are immune to altitude sickness and do not lose their Dexterity bonus to AC when making Climb or Acrobatics checks to cross narrow or slippery surfaces.

benefit.text: You don't lose your Dex bonus when crossing narrow srufaces

Rock Stepper.description: Geiter can skillfully navigate rocky terrain, ignoring difficult terrain caused by rubble, broken ground, or steep stairs.

Hatred.description: Geiter gain a +1 racial bonus on attack rolls made against Plant creatures.

Weapon Familiarity.description: Geiter are always proficient with Warhammers and Dwarven weapons.

benefit.text: Proficient with warhammers and Dwarven weapons

Darkvision.description: Geiter can see 60 feet in total darkness, this vision is black and white.

Shell.description: Kame gain a +3 natural armor bonus to AC.

Historian.description: Kame gain a +2 racial bonus on Knowledge (History) checks and treat it as a class skill.

Skill Training.description: Kame treat Knowledge (Geography) and Knowledge (Nature) as class skills.

benefit.text: Knowledge (Geo) and Knowledge (Nature) are class skills

Swim.description: Kame have a swim speed of 30 feet and get a +8 racial bonus on swim checks from the swim seed.

Amphibious.description: Kame can breathe both air and water.

benefit.text: Can breathe both air and water

Animal Friend.description: Zikari always treat Handle Animal and Ride as class skills.

benefit.text: Handle Animal and Ride are class skills

Animal Minded.description: Zikari get a +2 racial bonus on Handle Animal checks.

Natural Rider.description: Zikari get a +2 racial bonus on Ride checks.

Change Shape.description: All zikaru have an animal form they can change into. A zikaru can shift to and from this form as a move action that does not provoke AoO. This ability functions as Beast Shape II, with no components or duration, but the zikaru reverts back to their humanoid form when unconcious or dead.

Gatecrasher.description: Zikari gain a +2 racial bonus on Strength checks to break objects and a +2 racial bonus on combat maneuver checks to sunder.

benefit.text: +2 to break or sunder an object

Plagueborn.description: Tembo gain a +2 racial bonus on saving throws against disease, ingested poisons, and becoming nauseated or sickened.

benefit.text: +2 bonus vs disease, ingested poisons, nauseated, & sickened

Sprinter.description: Tembo gain a +10 foot racial bonus to their speed when charging, running, or withdrawing (but not double moving).

benefit.text: +10 ft when charging, running, or withdrawing

Tusks.description: Tembo can use their tusks as a primary natural attack. They can make one gore attack per round that deals 1d8 + half their Strength modifier piercing damage.

Stampede.description: A tembo deals 2d8 + one and a half times thier Strength modifier when using their tusks as part of a charge.

benefit.text: Gore does 2d8 + Str when part of a charge

Flight.description: Perwhüa have a fly speed of 30 feet with clumsy maneuverability.

Low-Light Vision.description: Perwhüa can see twice as far (60 feet) in dim light.

Slow Speed.description: Perwhüa are a slow people and have a base speed of 20 feet, which is never modified by armor or encumbrance.

Multi-Armed.description: Perwhüa have additional arms. They have 1 primary hand, but can wield weapons in their off hands. They have a total of 4 arms.

Aura-Touched.description: Kets'Rir may cast prestidigitation at will.

Low-Light Vision.description: Kets'Rir can see twice as far (60 feet) in dim light.

Quadruped.description: Kets'Rir have 4 legs and two arms, giving them a +4 racial bonus to CMD against trip attempts. They also use armor and weapons as if they were medium creatures.

benefit.text: 4 legs, 2 arms, and a +4 racial bonus vs Trip

surnames.meaning: Gargoyles don't typically have family names and are usually solitary

Stone Skin.description: Gargoyles get a +2 natural armor bonus to AC.

Flight.description: Gargoyles have a speed of 30 feet with clumsy maneuverability.

Flight 2.description: Most gargoyles have well developed wings, granting a +10 to their fly speed and increasing their maneuverability to poor.

Darkvision.description: Gargoyles can see 60 feet in total darkness in black and white vision.

Plant Immunity.description: Ents are immune to all mind-affecting effects (charms, compulsions, morale effects, patterns, and phantasms).

benefit.text: charms, compulsions, morale effects, patterns, phantasms

Plant Immunity 2.description: Ents are immune to paralysis, poison, polymorph, sleep effects, and stunning.

benefit.text: paralysis, poison, polymorph, sleep effects, stunning

Camouflage.description: Ents gain a +4 racial bonus to stealth checks when within a forest.

Low-Light Vision.description: Ents can see twice as far (60 feet) in dim light.

Slow Speed.description: Ents are a slow people and have a base speed of 20 feet which is never modified by armor or encumbrance.

Flammable.description: Ents are vulnerable to fire and take +50% damage fire based effects.

Treespeech.description: Ents are able to converse with plants as if they were constantly using the speak with plants spell.

Construct Resistance.description: Matoran get a +2 racial bonus on saving throws against disease, mind effects, poison, and effects that cause exhaustion or fatigue.

benefit.text: +2 vs disease, mind effects, poison, exhaustion, and fatigue

Swarming.description: Matoran are used to living and fighting communally with other matoran. Up to two matoran can share the same square, and if they attack the same foe while they are sharing a square, they are considered to be flanking that foe.

benefit.text: Can share a 5-foot square with other matoran, grants flanking

Weapon Familiarity.description: Matoran are proficient with Kanoka-Disks and Kanoka Disk Launchers.

Master Tinkerer.description: Ta-Matoran gain a +1 racial bonus on Disable Device and Knowledge (Engineering) checks, as well as having proficiency with any weapon they create.

benefit.text: +1 bonus on Disable Device and Knowledge (Engineering)

Learner.description: Ga-Matoran with an Intelligence score of 11 or higher gain comprehend languages, detect magic, detect poison, and read magic as spell-like abilities that cna be used once per day.

Swimmer.description: Ga-Matoran have a swim speed of 30 feet and gain the +8 racial bonus on swim checks that come with having a swim speed.

Tree-Topper.description: Once a day, Le-Matoran can roll a reflex saving throw twice and take the better result, this must be decided before rolling the saving throw.

Quick-Wit.description: Le-Matoran gain Improved Initiative as a bonus feat, granting them a +4 bonus to initiative.

Carver.description: Po-Matoran gain a +2 racial bonus on all Craft and Profession checks to create objects from metal or stone.

benefit.text: +2 Craft and Profession when using stone or metal

Stoneseer.description: Po-Matoran add +1 to the caster level of any spell they cast with the earth descriptior as well as gaining magic stone, stone shape, and steone tell as spell-like abilities, uasable once a day.

benefit.text: Treat your caster level as 1 higher for earth spells

Stonecunnign.description: Onu-Matoran gain a +2 racial bonus on Perception checks to notice unsual stonework, like traps and hidden doors.

Minesight.description: Onu-Matoran gain darkvision 90 feet, however they are dazzled in bright light and take a -2 penalty on saving throws against effects with the light descriptor.

Stalker.description: Ko-Matoran always treat Perception and Stealth as class skills.
Stalker.shortText: Perception and Stalth are class skills

Watch-Guard.description: Ko-Matoran can use keep watch as a spell-like ability once a day.
Watch-Guard.shortText: May cast Keep Watch once a day

Defensive Training.description: Dwarves gain a +4 dodge bonus to AC against monsters of the giant subtype.

Hardy.description: Dwarves gain a +2 racial bonus on saving throws against poison, spells, and spell-like abilities.

Stability.description: Dwarves gain a +4 racial bonus to their Combat Maneuver Defense when resisting a bull rush or trip attempt while standing on the ground.

Greed.description: Dwarves gain a +2 racial bonus on Appraise checks made to determine the price of non-magical goods that contain precious metals or gemstones.

Stonecunning.description: Dwarves gain a +2 bonus on Perception checks to notice unusual stonework, such as traps and hidden doors located in stone walls or floors. They receive a check to notice such features whenever they pass within 10 feet of them, whether or not they are actively looking.

Darkvision.description: Dwarves can see perfectly in the dark up to 60 feet.

Hatred.description: Dwarves gain a +1 racial bonus on attack rolls against humanoid creatures of the orc and goblinoid subtypes because of their special training against these hated foes.

Weapon Familiarity.description: Dwarves are proficient with battleaxes, heavy picks, and warhammers, and treat any weapon with the word “dwarven” in its name as a martial weapon.

Elven Immunities.description: Elves are immune to magic sleep effects and gain a +2 racial saving throw bonus against enchantment spells and effects.

Keen Senses.description: Elves receive a +2 racial bonus on Perception checks.

Elven Magic.description: Elves receive a +2 racial bonus on caster level checks made to overcome spell resistance. In addition, elves receive a +2 racial bonus on Spellcraft skill checks made to identify the properties of magic items.

Weapon Familiarity.description: Elves are proficient with longbows (including composite longbows), longswords, rapiers, and shortbows (including composite shortbows), and treat any weapon with the word “elven” in its name as a martial weapon.

Low-Light Vision.description: Elves can see twice as far as humans in conditions of dim light.

Defensive Training.description: Gnomes gain a +4 dodge bonus to AC against monsters of the giant subtype.

Illusion Resistance.description: Gnomes gain a +2 racial saving throw bonus against illusion spells and effects.

Keen Senses.description: Gnomes receive a +2 racial bonus on Perception checks.

Obsessive.description: Gnomes receive a +2 racial bonus on a Craft or Profession skill of their choice.

Gnome Magic.description: Gnomes add +1 to the DC of any saving throws for illusion spells that they cast. Gnomes with Charisma scores of 11 or higher also gain the following spell-like abilities: 1/day—dancing lights, ghost sound, prestidigitation, and speak with animals. The caster level is equal to the gnome’s level and the DC is equal to 10 + the spell’s level + the gnome’s Charisma modifier.

Hatred.description: Gnomes receive a +1 bonus on attack rolls against humanoid creatures of the reptilian and goblinoid subtypes because of their special training against these hated foes.

Weapon Familiarity.description: Gnomes treat any weapon with the word “gnome” in its name as a martial weapon.

Low-Light Vision.description: Gnomes can see twice as far as humans in conditions of dim light.

Fearless.description: Halflings receive a +2 racial bonus on all saving throws against fear. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by halfling luck.

Halfling Luck.description: Halflings receive a +1 racial bonus on all saving throws.

Sure-Footed.description: Halflings receive a +2 racial bonus on Acrobatics and Climb checks.

Weapon Familiarity.description: Halflings are proficient with slings and treat any weapon with the word “halfling” in its name as a martial weapon.

Keen Senses.description: Halflings receive a +2 racial bonus on Perception checks.

Bonus Feat (REPLACE).description: Humans select one extra feat at 1st level.

Skilled.description: Humans gain an additional skill rank at first level and one additional rank whenever they gain a level.

Diverse Heritage.description: Humans come in many forms, and as such they get a +2 racial bonus to a single ability score.

Armor.description: Kobolds' naturally scaly skin grants them a +1 natural armor bonus.

Crafty.description: Kobolds gain a +2 racial bonus on Craft (trapmaking), Perception, and Profession (miner) checks. Craft (trapmaking) and Stealth are always class skills for a kobold.

Darkvision.description: Kobolds can see perfectly in the dark up to 60 feet.

Light Sensitivity.description: Kobolds live in darkness and are dazzled in areas of bright sunlight.

Skilled.description: Goblins gain a +4 racial bonus on Ride and Stealth checks.

Fast Movement.description: Goblins gain a +10 foot racial bonus to their base speed.

Darkvision.description: Goblins can see perfectly in the dark up to 60 feet.

Sneaky.description: Hobgoblins receive a +4 racial bonus on Stealth checks.

Darkvision.description: Hobgoblins can see perfectly in the dark up to 60 feet.
